description: Path to the run’s .pth.tar checkpoint.
Recurrent init family {none, cent, cent-cyc, shifted, shifted-cyc, identity, shift, shift-cyc}.
Normalization directory used for the init {raw, frobenius}.
Mixing ratio (0–1) used for shifted/shift variants; None/blank otherwise.
Number of hidden units.
Base RNG seed used for the run.
If nonzero, training used one-step prediction (t→t+1).
User-supplied tag appended to output filenames.
Number of epochs in the saved loss curve.
Zero-based index of final epoch.
MSE at the last epoch.
Epoch index (argmin) of the loss curve.
Minimum loss attained during training.
First epoch where loss ≤ 1.10 × best_loss; proxy for convergence speed.
Area under the loss curve (trapezoidal rule); lower suggests faster optimization.
Global L2 norm of gradients before clipping/masking at last snapshot.
Global L2 norm of gradients after clipping/masking at last snapshot.
Global RMS grad magnitude before clipping/masking at last snapshot.
Global RMS grad magnitude after clipping/masking at last snapshot.
Mean of hidden activations (last snapshot; batch×time×units).
Std of hidden activations (last snapshot; unbiased=False).
Fraction |h|≥0.95 (tanh) at last snapshot; None if ReLU mode.
Mean per-time-step L2 norm of hidden state (last snapshot).
Mean lag-1 autocorrelation across units (last snapshot).
Index of the dominant non-DC RFFT magnitude averaged over batch×units (last snapshot).
(Σλ)^2 / Σλ^2 from covariance eigenspectrum of hidden states (last snapshot).
Linear decode of [cosθ, sinθ] from hidden states; mean R^2 (last snapshot).
Frobenius norm of recurrent weight W_hh (last snapshot).
Frobenius norm of S = (W+Wᵀ)/2 (last snapshot).
Frobenius norm of A = (W−Wᵀ)/2 (last snapshot).
Fraction of Frobenius energy in the symmetric component (last snapshot).
Fraction of Frobenius energy in the antisymmetric component (last snapshot).
Relative mix ||A||/||S|| (last snapshot).
|| W Wᵀ − Wᵀ W ||_F (last snapshot).
||W − W₀||_F (change from initial to current W_hh).
Frobenius drift normalized by ||W₀||_F.
Resultant-length concentration of Δθ between outputs and targets at the snapshot time window.
1 − R (lower is better).
Lag-1 autocorrelation of residual norms at the snapshot time window.
Mean L2 norm of residuals at the snapshot time window.
